comments.commentBody: Unequal protection of law is all we get from these "state's rights" brats. These people sell their citizens to rentiers at the state level.

If a foreign country or group such as Al Qaeda attempted to decimate our education system, environment, or citizen protections in the same manner attempted by the Bannon-Putin administration and Scott Walker, we would consider it an act of war.

After blasting a YUGE hole in the Wisconsin budget, Walker is looking to get a handout from the Feds. Infrastructure is crumbling in Wisconsin (to the extent that some localities are having to replace paved roads with gravel due to lack of funding). Walker removed hundreds of millions of dollars in funding from schools and universities. Now his legislature is revolting because they realize these are failed policies. But Walker will not let them raise revenue to keep vital services going. Now Walker is looking for a backhanded handout from the Feds. Shame on Walker from withholding health care and vital services from the people of Wisconsin!

Hopefully, the likes of Mr. Walker and Ohio's Mr. Kasich and South Carolina's Ms. Haley will re take the GOP's soul and give conservatism the meaning that it deserves. The constructionist approach that he presents here is in stark contrast to the vitriolic hate filled rhetoric that passes for policy from White House insiders led by Mr.Bannon. Mr.Walker showed resilience by winning the recall election. Most of his GOP cohorts may have great difficulty demonstrating that. The 2016 election showed that the bulk of the GOP leadership were spineless hypocrites with no grass roots standing! The "America First" grassroots of the GOP are not there yet!

As for the South, it did, in effect, secede, and stayed there right put through the likes of George Wallace and even to today in one Jeff "Secessions".
Trump meanwhile has chosen to "secede" from truth-telling...or, maybe, he's never practiced that simple moral value himself (I'm still trying to figure out which moral values he does practice).

What makes me laugh is the way some Republicans espouse the "liberty" and "for the people" argument, yet their policies actually detract from these very concepts. His points on employment are rhetoric. Employment nationwide has been improving (as an overall percentage) and made these gains under Obama. Aligning with the "repeal ACA" movement indicates this person's ignorance. A cursory review of the repeal "plan" easily shows that it is not an improvement for the ACA and WILL cost taxpayers more while improving the wealth of the top 1%. This "governor" talks of taking on the unions - what he doesn't tell you is that since the Reagan era, the GOP has aligned more and more with Big Business to squash the enrollment in unions in order to help Big Business create a larger return to the CEOs and stagnate workers wages. This ruse does not help the average worker.

People of Wisconsin need to out this "governor".

A typical response from the paranoid Left. "Republicans stand for the rich". They think Trump ,Romney, and Bush only wanted to help those in the .3% bracket. How superficial and naive. Behind what the Libs see as a tilt toward a privileged class, are men and women who understand the imbalance of our economic strata, while creating more opportunities for valid work, not redistribution by the State or Federal governments. How are you so opposed to that?

Scott Walker speaks of "intimidation by protesters" - and therein lies the problem. Walker and other politicians like him view protesters as enemies of the state - rather than the taxpayers that they are - which in turn prevents any possibility of discussion.  Protesters are using their 1st Amendment rights to express concern and disagreement, but the GOP has turned protest into a sign that Dems are waging war on American citizens. Walker is a tyrant. He does not listen, and if anyone stands up to him, he ends their political career.  Need proof? Find Mike Ellis or Dale Schultz.  They'll tell you all about how politics works in Wisconsin. And as a resident of Wisconsin, I can assure you "more taxpayer money" is NOT making its way into our hands.  Education funding has made its way into the hands of corrupt "voucher" schools that vanish into the night. Tax cuts have gone largely to those who are already wealthy. And little guys like me have seen their income fall by five digits under Walker.  America must reject Walker, his ideas, and anyone who subscribes to his ideas.  Wisconsin has become an angry, hateful, divided place to live.  And that's just how Walker wants it.

How ironic that Walker is playing his Jeffersonian card on having states tackle 'home' issues while he allies with a President who is overplaying his Hamiltonian card on issues such as quashing 'sanctuary' cities and states.  How ironic that he is playing his Hamiltonian cards on matter such as his distain for union organizers who are revealing who the true Queen of Spades is.  Walker is that spade card.
I might be wrong, but it seems to me that politicians ignoring their constituents is a recipe for long-term failure.

That is the reason that the left is no longer in power in the House, Senate and White House. We were tired of the left being more interested in pet social engineering projects and illegal immigrants than American citizens. The results of elections for the past few years shows what average citizens feel about the liberal view of this country.

They actually believe it is intellectually sophisticated to believe mutually contradictory things at the same time, and they always expect to have a cake and eat it too.

Many Americans are many cards short of a full deck.
So would this mean that states like New York would get to keep the taxes that they currently contribute to the Red Taker States. We could certainly make good use of those funds.

Every thing that the Republicans are in favor of are against the common man or for the rich, sometimes both at once. They will reduce taxes but predominately for the rich. The resulting deficit will be paid for by the middle class in the future. Increase government spending as a stimulus but mostly in those areas where big business gets the lion's share while cutting social services to pay for it!
It is time for us to take this to the streets because that is what they are afraid of - the people getting fed up with the lies!
Resist, every way in every day!
Indivisibles.

I am tired of the claim that all the founders thought states should be the ultimate center of political decision making. It simply is not true. Many founders thought the opposite, that the best path to modernity was through a strong central government. Washington certainly understood why it was necessary.

Given the reluctance for individual states to shoulder the burden of supplying clothing, arms and munitions during the Revolution made it all too clear that states would not own up to their responsibilities if there was no way to force them to pay their share.

The best evidence against the claim that states are the best suited to handle its own problems is clear. You only need to know the states where segregation was law before the civil rights protests of the 1950's and 60's.

Dear Amy,

I am so sorry that you are ill. And I believe you have done something wonderful for your husband. It is tragic to lose a spouse. You lose the person you love and you also lose the shared life you had together.

I lost my husband of 37 years back in 2008. I got married at 19 and we had a wonderful marriage. I thought that was it, that I would be living the rest of my life alone. But I'd made friends with a man in the ICU waiting room. His wife of 21 years had lung cancer. We were dealing with a lot of the same issues and doctors. It's not something that's easy to deal with. We lost our spouses within a day of each other. We talked over the phone a lot afterwards, and we married a year and a half ago.

Your husband will never forget you and it will be no disrespect to your memory if he finds someone to help him heal when you are gone. God bless you.
I love white gum balls combined with red ones AND this article.

Amy, we love your children's books. Your post reminds me of the way I felt when I read of Anna Dewdney's passing. Another wonderful female children's author taken too soon. I bought one your books, Plant a Kiss, for my daughters on Valentines Day. We found "Duck, Rabbit" in our basement where neighbors pass on books. And I received "Cookies" when my first daughter was born in 2009. I had no idea when I read your post how much a part of our family's life you have been and will continue to be. What a legacy. And it explains how you wrote this beautiful tribute to your life partner. You have taught me so much about love and how to talk about it with my two young daughters. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Peace and solace to you and your family.
That may be the most narcissistic essay I've seen in years.   Good lord.

Your hate is not strong enough to overcome real love, Titian. Strange that you read this essay all the way through, then commented on it. You took Amy's expression of love into your brain, and now it's in you, no matter what hate you spew out. Try to enjoy your day!
You need to read more.

Ms. Rosenthal,

To say your story is inspiring, life-affirming, and a romantically heart-breaking scenario is an understatement. Further, in some amazing twist of fate, I directed a feature film two years ago called Meet My Valentine, which is your story, only the husband ( also a Painter) is the one afflicted with cancer. Unbeknownst to his wife, he creates an online dating profile ( similar to your article here) for her, seeking his replacement after he's gone. I wish you and your family all of the best during this difficult time. Thank you for sharing your story.

Hey Scott, Lets test all on the government dole, eh? You and all the rest at the statehouse.

The party that is always complaining about the government is the first to use the government to torment their fellow citizens.

What a joke, and what a little bitch for the Kochs.

No, against facism protesters must stand strong! Against arrogant tyrants, the people must stand strong! Against republican subversion of our constitution, journalists must stand strong! Against the Scott Walkers of the world, tenacious people with good faith, resolve and courage must stand strong! The arc of the morl universe is long but it bends toward justice.

Let me ask an honest question. What is one specific thing Republicans have done, on a national level, and within the past 20 years, that has made life better for the average person? It just doesn't seem average people ever do well when Republicans are in charge.

" returning authority to the states"

Hypocritical nonsense. Walker is the poster boy for preventing local yokels from usurping federal protections for Americans, regardless of where they might live.

I have a simple message for Scott Walker: 2018 is right around the corner.

Yes the American Founders were wealthy elites who made their money as slave owners. Yes the Republicans yearn to take us back to those years and dullards like Walker and Brownback are destroying their states in order to accomplish that by driving down wages, giving money to the rich, and reducing public social spending.

The Republican troglodytes will destroy America. It is time to throw the Ugly Republicans out of power.

And just how are the states, which are more corrupt and subject to big dollar influences, better at healthcare?  Name one person in the whole country who will get better health care as a result of repeal of the ACA - lower tax bills for the rich don't count.
